alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 3:38PM EDT until July 05 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Floyd and Pike. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Wheelwright, Shelbiana, Chloe, Osborn, Garden Village, Galveston, Beaver, Raccoon, Craynor, Buckhorn Hollow, Ligon, Melvin, Fishtrap Lake, East McDowell, Hi Hat, Orkney, McDowell, Burton and Phyllis.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
